key_myths.title: Miraculous Birth
key_myths.summary: • Nezha was born to Lady Yin after three years and six months of pregnancy. He emerged as a ball of flesh, which his father Li Jing (later the Pagoda-Bearing Heavenly King) struck with his sword. From the flesh emerged a fully-formed child wearing the Universe Ring and Red Armillary Sash, gifts from his immortal teacher Taiyi Zhenren.

key_myths.title: Slaying of Ao Bing
key_myths.summary: • While bathing in the sea, young Nezha's magical sash stirred the Dragon King's underwater palace. When the Dragon King sent his third son Ao Bing to investigate, Nezha killed him in the ensuing confrontation. This act triggered divine retribution from the Dragon Kings of the Four Seas, who demanded justice from the Jade Emperor.

key_myths.title: Filial Sacrifice
key_myths.summary: • To protect his parents from the Dragon Kings' wrath, Nezha committed suicide by cutting out his own flesh and returning it to his mother and his bones to his father. This extreme act of filial piety released his parents from responsibility for his deeds, but left his spirit wandering without a body.

key_myths.title: Lotus Rebirth
key_myths.summary: • His teacher Taiyi Zhenren reconstructed Nezha's body from lotus roots, lotus leaves, and lotus flowers, giving him immortal form and even greater powers. Reborn as the Lotus Prince, Nezha sought revenge against his father Li Jing for destroying his temple, but was ultimately reconciled through Buddha's intervention.

key_myths.title: War Against the Shang
key_myths.summary: • In the Fengshen Yanyi, Nezha serves as a general in King Wu's army against the tyrannical King Zhou of Shang. He battles numerous demons and enemy generals, contributing to the establishment of the Zhou Dynasty and the investiture of the gods.

key_myths.title: Journey to the West
key_myths.summary: • Nezha attempts to capture Sun Wukong on behalf of the Jade Emperor. Despite his formidable powers, he is defeated by the Monkey King, demonstrating both his warrior prowess and the exceptional nature of Sun Wukong's abilities.

archetype.description: Nezha embodies the Divine Child archetype - miraculous birth, supernatural powers from youth, rebellion against authority, death and rebirth into greater form.
